intro: Neopringlea, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking, translucent petals that resemble ghostly apparitions, giving it its ethereal appearance. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, Neopringlea thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom during the evening, attracting specific pollinators. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
